newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian Stocks to Watch Today - April 15.
newsitem.headline: Australian Stocks to Watch Today - April 15.

text.p: Some Australian stocks to watch this morning:
* Mt Leyshon Gold Mines Ltd A$1.90 (-0.03)

Mt Leyshon Gold Mines Ltd on Tuesday reported a consolidated net profit for the nine months to March 31 of A$15.1 million. The unaudited profit for the third quarter was A$5.7 million, the company said. Mt Leyshon Gold Mines also said on Monday it has recommended shareholders not accept the takeover offer from fellow gold miner St Barbara Mines Ltd.

Diamond miner Ashton Mining Ltd said on Tuesday that third quarter production had been close to plan with 7.04 million carats produced. This compared to fourth quarter production in 1996 of 9.45 milion carats.
QBE Insurance said on Tuesday it had agreed to buy 74.9 percent of Trade Indemnity Assurance Ltd, which has gross written premium income of close to A$40 million a year.
Workers at Chile's huge Escondida copper mine will vote Tuesday whether to strike or to accept the company's pay offer in the first collective negotiations at the pit.

Heavy engineering group Evans Deakin Industries Ltd said on Monday it had won a further contract for the supply of 10 new passenger railcars to Perth's Westrail. The company said its share of the A$32.8 million contract was A$13.9 million.
